body_html:
Well I managed to build the library and use it with Tensorflow mobile but the results were disappointing (almost 2 seconds inference for object detection). Did you get better results when using tflite ?

to get it to work on Tensorflow mobile I cloned Tensorflow with this line to avoid protobuf compilation errors:
git clone --recurse-submodules https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow.git

then proceeded normally building the library from source and followed the instruction used in the issue you referenced and it worked for me.

Note : create a virtualenv and clone and build tensorflow from there, it isolates it and help avoid any conflict problems.

Well I managed to build the library and use it with Tensorflow mobile but the results were disappointing (almost 2 seconds inference for object detection). Did you get better results when using tflite ?
to get it to work on Tensorflow mobile I cloned Tensorflow with this line to avoid protobuf compilation errors:
git clone --recurse-submodules https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow.git 
then proceeded normally building the library from source and followed the instruction used in the issue you referenced and it worked for me.
Note : create a virtualenv and clone and build tensorflow from there, it isolates it and help avoid any conflict problems.
body:
Well I managed to build the library and use it with `Tensorflow mobile` but the results were disappointing (almost 2 seconds inference for object detection). Did you get better results when using `tflite` ? 

to get it to work on `Tensorflow mobile` I cloned `Tensorflow` with this line to avoid protobuf compilation errors: 
`git clone --recurse-submodules https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow.git `

then proceeded normally building the library from source and followed the instruction used in the issue you referenced and it worked for me.

**Note :** create a `virtualenv` and clone and build `tensorflow` from there, it isolates it and help avoid any conflict problems.
